special_features: The Perfect Scenario: The End of Dreams

releases.details: Part of the Time Lord Victorious multimedia event
Released as part of the second Dalek Tin set

notes: The story is recognized as a reworking of The Daleks.
Terry Nation was unaware that episode titles had been dropped.
Katy Manning's character was credited as 'Jo' only in Radio Times for episode four.

real_world_cultural_references: The contemporary Vietnam War influences in the story.

continuity_notes: Continuing the storyline from Frontier in Space.
Introduces elements leading into the Second Dalek War.

plot.plot_summary: Episode one: The Doctor and Jo arrive on Spiridon where they encounter a group of Thals, only to discover that the Daleks are hiding and can become invisible.
Episode two: Jo tries to help the Doctor recover while they learn about the Daleks' weakness regarding light waves and the Spiridons' enslavement.
Episode three: Jo infiltrates the Dalek base while the Thals and the Doctor find the Dalek army stored in suspended animation.
Episode four: The group escapes from the Daleks using a makeshift hot-air balloon while plotting to destroy the Dalek base.
Episode five: Plans are uncovered regarding the Daleks using a deadly bacterium, and attempts are made to sabotage their operations.
Episode six: The Doctor and the Thals execute their plan to freeze the Dalek army and escape as the Dalek Supreme orders a recovery operation.
